fields.summary: BlackBerry: KitchenSink: BaseUI > Views > Events Propogation; tapping on labels gives us "you clicked on view"

fields.description:
h5.Description:
1. Launch KS.
2. Go to BaseUI --> views -->event interaction.
3. Tap on the label " click on me" inside the box.

h5.Actual Result:
1. Nothing happens.

h5.Expected Result:
1. The two labels at the left top should say "you were able to click on the box.Good!" & "you were able to click on the label.Good!"
fields.summary: BlackBerry: KitchenSink: BaseUI > Views > Events Interaction clicking on the label "click on me" does nothing
fields.environment:
Environment:
Appc Studio : 3.2.3.201403250634
Ti SDK : 3.2.2.GA
Mac OSX : 10.8.5
Alloy : 1.3.1	
CLI - 3.2.3-dev
BB Z10 - 10.2.1.2.2156
Kitchensink from studio (3.2.2)

comments.body:
Bug (BaseUI > Views > Events Interaction clicking on the label "click on me" does nothing) still occurs on:

Mac OSX 10.9.4 
Appcelerator Studio, build: 3.4.0.201408180158
Titanium SDK build: 3.4.0.v20140819094113
Titanium CLI, build: 3.4.0-dev 
Alloy: 1.5.0-dev 
Blackberry Device Z10 (10.2.1.2947) 
Blackberry Sim (10.3)
iOS Device 5s (8.0b5)

Followed the test steps in the description, when tapping the label the labels at the top still do not change, verified that this does work on other platforms by testing on iOS7 and that produces the expected result.
Placing these items on hold for the moment based on community interest.
Closing ticket as BlackBerry is no longer supported by us.
